intro: Picris auriculata, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, arranged in dense, cup-shaped clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in fine hairs, giving them a distinctive appearance. The plant is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands.
